Articles.Content:
I dont know if someone done this before, but here is my recreation of the ISS.

Its not finished and i dont know how i can get this thing into orbit, but maybe you can give me a suggestion to do so.

old design

Kerbal it into orbit. More boosters, and two to three hundred RCS.

sounds good to me.
Wrong section, goes into spacecraft exchange.
i wrote that on top of the post and i wanted to post it there, but when i first wrote the post i accidentally closed it and then chosed the wrong tab..

can a mod please move it to Spacecraft exchange

Mods rarely read the topics. To make it faster you may press \'report to moderator\' button at the bottom of your post and specify \'move to another section\' in the \'comment\' field.

Technically there is no craft file for download so it\'s not really CraftEx material. For now, this would be the best place for it. When you have a craft file to download, you can make a new post in the CraftEx.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Forum Moderator

Impressive!

Tried to rebuild the ISS myself but wasn\'t very satisfied with the result.

Also it was the pure hell to fly and breaks into tiny pieces right when I decouple it from the rocket. Please try to get your version into orbit and post how you\'ve done that

At the moment im trying to get this thing into orbit ???

Its very wobbly and i needed to balance it but i made it to about 30.000m

on the launch pad

here the picture i used to recreate the iss

I cant wait for persistence 8)
It looks quite realistic. The quality of spacestation parts is increasing every day!

I rebuilt the whole station and added a bit more detail but its still impossible to get it into orbit

Also i replaced the Vanguard with the Hope shuttle.

Maybe I could help - I\'ve tested my Satoorn Mk2-9 with heavy loads and suffice to say it can take it.

but now im trying to built a design that is able to get this into orbit

nice design but i think my station is to wobbly and to bigi would really like to try that but i think you can\'t stick 2 crafts together, i would need to rebuilt the whole thing

but now im trying to built a design that is able to get this into orbit

My design is quite simple so it wouldn\'t be too hard to rebuild it.

it\'s basically: (using symettry ofc)

decoupler // Don\'t

1x RCS tank // really

3x RCS thrusters // need those 3

decoupler

tricoupler

3x fuel tank

1x liq engine

3x lat. decouplers

1x fuel tank

1x liq engine

here would be a stack decoupler, but I don\'t really use it.

2x fuel tank

1x liq engine

now addons: struts between the 3 fuel tank clusters and between the fuel tanks in them, 2x wings (the ones that can move around)

ok im trying that next but at first i need to balance it.

at the moment the side with the shuttle weights to much

ok im trying that next but at first i need to balance it.

at the moment the side with the shuttle weights to much

I was thinking that might be a problem

Try attaching some detacheable fuel tanks on the side and connect them to other fuel tanks with the fuel connectors, that might help.

your design is very good for much thrust

i got it almost balanced now

your design is very good for much thrust

i got it almost balanced now

Thanks, it\'s my pride

Well at least for now, I\'m working on a project that is going to blow people\'s mind IMO. If you want I can give you some screenshots and a description through PM
you can send me the screenshots
I sent them, hope you enjoy. And don\'t tell anyone, it\'s my top secret project 8)

Building a space station by taking parts into space?

That\'s not kerbal..

Boosting the entire space station in a single launch into space?

Now THAT\'s kerbal!

KSP 14 x2 is released.

I would love to see that in orbit now.
